description:
Merge or split on series, scalar, or label dimensions.

Given input CIFTI files for which mappings along the selected direction are the same type, all either series, scalars, or labels, and the other dimensions are index-compatible, this command concatenates the data in the specified indices/ranges along the selected direction (by default, on typical 2D cifti, concatenate horizontally, so rows become longer).  The direction can be either an integer starting from 1, or the strings 'ROW' or 'COLUMN'.

Example: wb_command -cifti-merge out.dtseries.nii -cifti first.dtseries.nii -index 1 -cifti second.dtseries.nii

This example would take the first column from first.dtseries.nii, followed by all columns from second.dtseries.nii, and write these columns to out.dtseries.nii.

opt_direction_direction.title: opt_direction_direction
opt_direction_direction.description: merge in a direction other than along rows: the dimension to split/concatenate along, default ROW

opt_mem_limit_limit_gb.title: opt_mem_limit_limit_gb
opt_mem_limit_limit_gb.description: restrict memory used for file reading efficiency: memory limit in gigabytes

cifti_in.title: cifti_in
cifti_in.description: a cifti file to use data from

index.title: index
index.description: the index number (starting from 1), or name

last_index.title: last_index
last_index.description: the number or name of the last index to include

opt_reverse.title: opt_reverse
opt_reverse.description: use the range in reverse order

anyOf.description: use an inclusive range of indices

up_to.description: use an inclusive range of indices

items.description: select a single index to use

index.description: select a single index to use
